intro: Ribes cynosbati f. inerme, commonly known as the smooth gooseberry, is a variant of the gooseberry plant characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves. It belongs to the genus Ribes within the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other shrubs and plants with edible berries. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and have a slightly serrated margin. The smooth gooseberry produces small, yellow to orange berries that are often used in culinary applications, though they are less commonly consumed than other gooseberry varieties.
